moves.1. e3 d5 2. d4 Nc6 3. Bb5 Bd7 4. Bxc6 Bx: When attacked on the kingside, counter in the center or queenside. That's the old saying, but here defensive moves start to become a complete necessity.
moves.13... Qh4 14. Kg2 Qh3+:
Oops!
14. ...Qd4+ 15. f3, Rh2+ 16. Kg1, Qh4 -- and nothing can prevent mate in 2.

Here I realized that I should be better anyway with the game continuation, but another big mistake is made almost immediately.
moves.15. Kf3 g2+ 16. Ng3 gxf1=Q:
Silly!
First Bxg3, THEN capture! Here I gave up the chance to be a queen up...
moves.17. Qxf1 Qxf1 18. Nxf1 O-O-O 19. Bd2 f5: No chance of a draw from here on out.
